intro: Wilbrandia ebracteata var. ebracteata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved wilbrandia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces showy, yellow flowers with prominent stamens. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical structure reflects adaptations to its humid, tropical habitat.
